Pre-Game Insights: Golden State Warriors are 2-0 and fifth in the Western Conference, while Los Angeles Clippers are 0-1 and eleventh. The Warriors finished 46-36 overall and 26-26 in Western Conference action last season, allowing 115.2 points per game and shooting 46.6% from the field. The Clippers finished 51-31 overall and 9-7 in Pacific Division play, averaging 115.6 points per game, 18.3 on free throws, and 37.8 from beyond the arc. The Warriors have no listed injuries, while the Clippers are missing Mo Bamba (knee) and Kawhi Leonard (knee).
